intro: Haloragis acutangula f. obturbinata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved waterwheel plant, is a flowering plant species native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haloragaceae and is characterized by its submerged or floating leaves that are often narrow and pointed. The plant typically grows in freshwater habitats such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in whorls along the stems. It plays an important ecological role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
